glsa.title: tcpdump: Integer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been discovered in tcpdump, allowing for the execution of arbitrary code, possibly with root privileges.

background.p: tcpdump is a tool for capturing and inspecting network traffic.

description.p: mu-b from Digital Labs discovered that the return value of a snprintf() call is not properly checked before being used. This could lead to an integer overflow.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send specially crafted BGP packets on a network being monitored with tcpdump, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running tcpdump, which is usually root.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
